description:
**Problem**
ReplicatedFsync(k) requires a truthful view of which peers have durably ACKed which watermarks and head hashes. A naive map risks mixing namespaces or ignoring head hash divergence.

**Context**
- REALTIME_PLAN.md ยง0.12 (applied vs durable + head sha), ยง10.1-10.3 (durability coordination), ยง9.5 (ACK semantics)
- Stateright model: beads_stateright_models/src/realtime_types_sketch.rs (Watermarks<Durable>, HeadStatus)

**Files:** src/daemon/repl/peer_acks.rs (new), src/daemon/durability_coordinator.rs, src/daemon/store_runtime.rs
design:
**Design**
- PeerAckTable tracks per peer: durable Watermarks<Durable>, optional durable_heads, and last_ack_at_ms.
- Enforce monotonicity on update: seq may only advance; head sha must match the seq (reject divergence).
- Provide queries: acked_by(ns, origin, seq) -> Vec<ReplicaId>, and satisfied_k(ns, origin, seq, k) -> bool.
- Maintain per-namespace eligibility via roster (durability_eligible); only count eligible peers.
- Surface divergence: if a peer reports the same seq but a different head sha, mark that peer as diverged and exclude from durability quorum.
title: Phase 5: PeerAckTable for durability coordination

description:
**Problem**
CLI handlers perform read-modify-write for labels and parent relationships. `src/cli/commands/label.rs` fetches each issue then sends a full `Update` patch, and `src/cli/commands/update.rs` queries deps then removes/adds parent edges. This makes changes non-atomic, adds round trips, and splits core behavior across CLI and daemon.

**Design**
Add daemon-side ops for label and parent mutations and switch CLI to use them:
- Extend IPC `Request` with `AddLabels { repo, id, labels: Vec<String> }` and `RemoveLabels { repo, id, labels: Vec<String> }`, or a single `UpdateLabels { add, remove }` request.
- Add `SetParent { repo, id, parent: Option<String> }` that replaces existing parent edges in one mutation.
- Implement handlers in `src/daemon/executor.rs` that apply the changes atomically in a single WAL mutation, validating label formats and parent existence.
- Update CLI `label` commands to call the new label ops; update `update` to call `SetParent` when `--parent/--no-parent` is provided.
- Keep response payloads consistent (use `OpResult::Updated` or add a small label/parent result if needed for clarity).

**Design Notes**
This keeps CLI thin and centralizes behavior in the daemon. It also avoids subtle races (labels changed between fetch and update) and makes parent updates atomic.

**Acceptance**
- [ ] CLI label add/remove no longer fetches issues; daemon applies label changes atomically.
- [ ] Parent updates are handled by a dedicated daemon op; CLI no longer manipulates deps directly.
- [ ] Label validation errors and missing parent errors remain user-friendly.
- [ ] Run `codex review --uncommitted` (timeout 10m) and address findings.
- [ ] Tests pass.

**Files:** `src/daemon/ipc.rs`, `src/daemon/ops.rs`, `src/daemon/executor.rs`, `src/cli/commands/label.rs`, `src/cli/commands/update.rs`, `src/api/mod.rs`
title: Move label/parent updates into daemon ops
